attributes.action: Allow UK citizens to call for a referendum on confidence in the government.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that the electorate should be given more say in the running of the country and that the current system of government with a fixed term of office can become undemocratic given the timescales between the electorate having a voice to raise their concerns between general elections. This allows for the ruling party to force unpopular decision onto the electorate without the electorate having the ability to respond.
attributes.background: Change the law allowing UK citizens to hold a referendum where there's widespread concern & confidence within the electorate over the governments performance, policies & conformance to their published manifesto. The referendum should be a yes/no vote followed by a general election if successful.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition: 

Change the law, so that UK citizens can force an immediate General Election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/702341
